data.content:
adverb
on the part of the stage that the audience cannot see :behind or to the side of the stage
She waited offstage for her cue.
We heard a loud crash offstage. - compare backstage, onstage
of a performer :in private life
Offstage, the actress is very down-to-earth.
in a place that is away from public view :behind the scenes
Much of the important work of the conference was done offstage.
